# swagger-java-client

Docket API
- API version: 0.1.0
  - Build date: 2019-01-21T19:10:45.067Z

No description provided (generated by Swagger Codegen https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen)


*Automatically generated by the [Swagger Codegen](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.7+
2. Maven/Gradle

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>io.swagger</groupId>
  <artifactId>swagger-java-client</artifactId>
  <version>1.0.0</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
compile "io.swagger:swagger-java-client:1.0.0"
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/swagger-java-client-1.0.0.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java

import io.swagger.client.*;
import io.swagger.client.auth.*;
import io.swagger.client.model.*;
import io.swagger.client.api.AuthApi;

import java.io.File;
import java.util.*;

public class AuthApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        
        AuthApi apiInstance = new AuthApi();
        AuthPostRequestBody authPostRequestBody = new AuthPostRequestBody(); // AuthPostRequestBody | 
        try {
            InlineResponse200 result = apiInstance.auth(authPostRequestBody);
            System.out.println(result);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling AuthApi#auth");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

```

## Documentation for API Endpoints

All URIs are relative to *http://localhost:3000/v1*

Class | Method | HTTP request | Description
------------ | ------------- | ------------- | -------------
*AuthApi* | [**auth**](docs/AuthApi.md#auth) | **POST** /auth | Issues a JWT
*DocumentationApi* | [**getDocs**](docs/DocumentationApi.md#getDocs) | **GET** /docs | Returns an OpenAPI 3.0 spec.
*GoogleApi* | [**getGoogleAuthTokens**](docs/GoogleApi.md#getGoogleAuthTokens) | **GET** /google/tokens | Get Google OAuth tokens
*GoogleApi* | [**getGoogleAuthUrl**](docs/GoogleApi.md#getGoogleAuthUrl) | **GET** /google/url | Get Google OAuth URL
*MeApi* | [**createMyEvent**](docs/MeApi.md#createMyEvent) | **POST** /me/events | Creates a new event for the current user
*MeApi* | [**deleteMe**](docs/MeApi.md#deleteMe) | **DELETE** /me | Deletes the current user
*MeApi* | [**deleteMyEventById**](docs/MeApi.md#deleteMyEventById) | **DELETE** /me/events/{id} | Deletes an event for the current user
*MeApi* | [**getMe**](docs/MeApi.md#getMe) | **GET** /me | Fetches the current user
*MeApi* | [**getMyEventById**](docs/MeApi.md#getMyEventById) | **GET** /me/events/{id} | Fetches a specific event for the current user
*MeApi* | [**getMyEvents**](docs/MeApi.md#getMyEvents) | **GET** /me/events | Fetches all events for the current user
*MeApi* | [**updateMe**](docs/MeApi.md#updateMe) | **PUT** /me | Updates the current user
*MeApi* | [**updateMyEventById**](docs/MeApi.md#updateMyEventById) | **PUT** /me/events/{id} | Updates an event for the current user
*StatusApi* | [**getHealthCheck**](docs/StatusApi.md#getHealthCheck) | **GET** /health-check | Health check
*UserApi* | [**confirmUser**](docs/UserApi.md#confirmUser) | **GET** /users/confirm/{code} | Confirms user&#39;s registration
*UserApi* | [**createUser**](docs/UserApi.md#createUser) | **POST** /users | Create a user
*UserApi* | [**forgotPassword**](docs/UserApi.md#forgotPassword) | **POST** /users/forgot-password | Forgot password
*UserApi* | [**resetPassword**](docs/UserApi.md#resetPassword) | **POST** /users/reset-password | Reset password

## Documentation for Authorization

Authentication schemes defined for the API:
### bearerAuth

- **Type**: API key
- **API key parameter name**: Authorization
- **Location**: HTTP header


## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
